ci-cd.title: CI / CD Integration
ci-cd.description: The prokodo CLI is designed to run headlessly in any CI environment.

commands/auth.title: auth
commands/auth.description: Manage your prokodo API key credentials.

commands/doctor.title: doctor
commands/doctor.description: Check your environment health before running verifications.

commands/init.title: init
commands/init.description: Scaffold a .prokodo/config.json configuration file in the current project directory.

commands/overview.title: Command Overview
commands/overview.description: The prokodo CLI exposes five top-level commands.  Each is documented on its own page.

commands/verify.title: verify
commands/verify.description: Upload project files and trigger a cloud verification run.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: The prokodo CLI uses a per-project configuration file: .prokodo/config.json.

getting-started/quick-start.title: Quick Start
getting-started/quick-start.description: This guide gets you from zero to a successful cloud verification in under five minutes.

global-options.title: Global Options
global-options.description: Every prokodo CLI command accepts these options in addition to its own flags.  Pass them before or after the command name.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: The prokodo CLI is the official command-line interface for the prokodo marketplace. It lets you authenticate, configure projects, upload files for cloud verification, and inspect your environment ‚Äî all without leaving the terminal.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common errors and how to fix them.
